alert.note: Alert for Davidson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 1:57PM CST until February 28 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Cumberland River At Nashville affecting Davidson County. For the Cumberland River...including Nashville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cumberland River At Nashville. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Low lying areas along the river from the I-24 bridge to the I-65 bridge are significantly inundated, including riverfront recreation areas and access points near Nissan Stadium. Industrial properties along the river should monitor further increases in river levels. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CST Thursday the stage was 34.4 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will rise to 34.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall to 31.5 feet and begin rising again Sunday morning. It will rise to 31.6 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 30.0 feet. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 800 AM CST.
